clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of SIMEOX on Static Hyperinflation in Patients With COPD
clinical_study.official_title: Short-term Effects of SIMEOX on Static Hyperinflation in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the effects on the SIMEOX technology on static hyperinflation in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a crossover study assessing the short-term effects of SIMEOX and PEP device on static hyperinflation in patients with COPD.
Patients will perform lung function tests (to assess the residual volume and functional residual capacity) before, after and 30 minutes after a 20-min long session of SIMEOX or PEP (depending of randomization).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The visits include sessions (test 1 and 2) with SIMEOX or a positive expiratory pressure device (PEP) (chosen according to the subject's randomization) lasting 20 minutes, each followed by a rest period of 30 minutes. Lung function tests will be performed before, after and 30 minutes after performing the devices (SIMEOX and PEP).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in functional residual capacity (FRC) using body plethysmography
primary_outcome.description: FRCpleth before, after and 30 minutes after performing SIMEOX and PEP will be compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in functional residual capacity (FRC) using helium dilution
primary_outcome.description: FRChe before, after and 30 minutes after performing SIMEOX and PEP will be compared.
FRCpleth - FRChe before, after and 30 minutes after performing SIMEOX and PEP will be compared.

arm_group.description: Participants will have to perform 20 minutes of SIMEOX. Passive exhalation is required using the SIMEOX, starting from tidal volume and going until achieving residual volume.
Participants will have to perform 20 minutes of PEP. Active exhalation is required using a PEP device, starting from tidal volume and going until achieving residual volume.

intervention.description: SIMEOX is a device generating a succession of gentle depression at the mouth.
A PEP device (Pari-PEP) will be used to provoke a positive expiratory pressure while exhaling, thereby stabilizing the airways during expiration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease,
- Forced expiratory volume in 1s (FEV1) <80% of predicted value,
- Stable condition (no pulmonary exacerbation for more than 28 days).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Routine use of one of the two treatments - SIMEOX and/or PEP,
- Inability to understand or carry out the instructions,
- Severe cardiac comorbidity, neuromuscular disease,
- Severe scoliosis,
- Patient with a pacemaker.
